intro: Pachyphyllum herzogii, commonly known as the Herzog’s stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of Namibia and Angola. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to survive in dry environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in xeriscaping.
